Class phButt

java.lang.Object
java.awt.geom.RectangularShape
java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D
java.awt.Rectangle
phButt
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.Shape, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
public class phButt
extends java.awt.Rectangle

phButt

This is a custom button class that has 3 appearances: hovered over, clicked on, or nothing done to it at all
Since:
2022-1-5
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D

    java.awt.Graphics2D d

    Image that the button image is drawn onto
    java.awt.image.BufferedImage[] imgRoster
    Array of images the button can appear in.
    java.awt.Point pwp
    The coordinates that the button redirects the camera to after being clicked

    Creates a phButt object with coordinates for it's location on a buffer, length, width, point that the button changes the screen's location to, and file names for the 3 appearances of the button

  • Field Details

    • pwp

      public java.awt.Point pwp
      The coordinates that the button redirects the camera to after being clicked

    • drawme

      public java.awt.image.BufferedImage drawme
      Image that the button image is drawn onto

    • d

      public java.awt.Graphics2D d
      Graphics object of drawme (used to draw the button image onto the drawme image)

    • imgRoster

      public java.awt.image.BufferedImage[] imgRoster
      Array of images the button can appear in. 0 - default (no hover, no click), 1 - hovered over, 2 - clicked

  • Constructor Details

    • phButt

      public phButt​(int intX, int intY, int intW, int intH, int pwpX, int pwpY, java.lang.String imgdef, java.lang.String imghov, java.lang.String imgprs)
      Creates a phButt object with coordinates for it's location on a buffer, length, width, point that the button changes the screen's location to, and file names for the 3 appearances of the button
      Parameters:
      intX - X-coordinate of button on the buffer
      intY - Y-coordinate of button on the buffer
      intW - Width of the button
      intH - Height of the button
      pwpX - X-coordinate of the camera redirect
      pwpY - Y-coordinate of the camera redirect
      imgdef - File name of default appearance of the button
      imghov - File name of the hovered over appearance of the button
      imgprs - File name of the clicked appearance of the button

  • Method Details

    • changelook

      public boolean changelook​(java.awt.Point mousePos, boolean mouseDown, boolean retriggerCatch)
      This method checks if the button is being hovered over or being clicked, and changes the button's appearance accordingly
      Parameters:
      mousePos - The point of the cursor
      mouseDown - Whether or not the mouse is being clicked
      retriggerCatch - Whether the button's clicked function has already been triggered
      Returns:
      Whether or not the button is being clicked

    • img

      public java.awt.image.BufferedImage img​(java.lang.String fileName)
      This method looks for an image INSIDE the .jar file with the requested file name and returns the image
      Parameters:
      fileName - The file name of the requested image
      Returns:
      The image version of the requested file name
